User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user (dealer or admin) in the Gajanan Motors application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

phone.description: The user's phone number, used for authentication and contact.

isPro.description: Indicates whether the user has a Pro subscription.

proExpiresAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the Pro subscription expires.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

adCredits.description: Number of ad listings remaining for the user.

isPhoneVerified.description: Indicates if the user's phone number has been verified via OTP.

aadharUrl.description: Storage URL for the user's Aadhar card image.

panUrl.description: Storage URL for the user's PAN card image.

shopLicenseUrl.description: Storage URL for the user's Shop License image.

Ad.title: Ad
Ad.description: Represents a car advertisement posted by a dealer.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ad entity.

make.description: The make of the car (e.g., Toyota).

model.description: The model of the car (e.g., Camry).

variant.description: The variant of the car model (e.g., ZXi, VXi).

year.description: The year the car was manufactured.

kmDriven.description: The number of kilometers the car has been driven.

fuelType.description: The type of fuel the car uses (e.g., petrol, diesel).

transmission.description: The type of transmission (e.g., automatic, manual).

description.description: A detailed description of the car.

location.description: The location where the car is being sold.

images.description: Array of storage URLs for the car images.

features.description: List of notable features of the car.

status.description: The status of the ad (active, sold, removed).

visibility.description: Controls if the ad is visible in the public marketplace.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the ad was created.

soldAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the ad was marked as sold (can be null).

removedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the ad was removed (can be null).

removalPaid.description: Indicates whether the removal fee has been paid.

removalPaymentId.description: Reference to Payment. (Relationship: Payment 1:1 Ad Removal). The payment id for the removal fee (can be null).

Payment.title: Payment
Payment.description: Represents a payment made by a dealer for a subscription or ad removal.

id.description: Unique identifier for the payment entity.

adId.description: Reference to Ad. (Relationship: Ad 1:N Payment). The ad ID associated with the payment (can be null for subscriptions).

type.description: The type of payment (subscription or removal).

razorpayPaymentId.description: The ID of the payment in Razorpay.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the payment was created.

Commission.title: Commission
Commission.description: Represents a commission charged on an ad.

id.description: Unique identifier for the commission entity.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the commission was created.

AuditLog.title: AuditLog
AuditLog.description: Represents an audit log entry for an action performed in the application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the audit log entity.

action.description: The action that was performed (e.g., ad creation, ad removal).

performedBy.description: The ID of the user who performed the action. Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N AuditLog)

meta.description: Metadata associated with the action (e.g., details about the ad being created).

timestamp.description: Timestamp indicating when the action was performed.

definition.description: Stores commission records for ads. Accessible by admins. No denormalized authorization fields.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to provide a secure, scalable, and easily maintainable backend for the Gajanan Motors application, focusing on authorization independence and clear security rules.

*   **Authorization Independence:** Achieved through denormalization. For instance, access to `cars` is based on the `dealerId` field within the `car` document itself. This strategy avoids hierarchical authorization dependencies and enables atomic operations.

*   **Structural Segregation:** Collections are segregated based on their security requirements. User data, cars, payments, commissions, and audit logs are stored in separate top-level collections to simplify security rules.

*   **Access Modeling:** Admin specific data will be stored in collections such as `roles_admin/{userId}` to denote user roles.

*   **QAPs (Rules are not Filters):** Secure `list` operations are supported by structural segregation and authorization independence. For example, listing ads for a specific dealer is secured by querying the `cars` collection for a specific `dealerId`. The admin can use a collection group query on `/cars` to view all ads with appropriate authorization rules.

*   **Invariants:** The structure supports the integrity of ownership, timestamps, and denormalized data. Ownership is enforced through the `dealerId` field in the `cars` collection. Timestamps (`createdAt`, `soldAt`, `removedAt`) maintain data integrity. Denormalization ensures that authorization context is readily available within each document.
